de.timeout.libs.sql

Class MySQL

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.timeout.libs.sql.MySQL

  • public class MySQL
extends java.lang.Object
    This Class is a Hook into the MySQL-Database
    Author:
    timeout

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MySQL.Column
      This is a column of the table.
      static class  MySQL.Row
      This class represents a complete row in the table
      static class  MySQL.Table
      This class is an instance of a typical mysql table.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public boolean connect(java.lang.String username,
                       java.lang.String password)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Connect to MySQL-Database, but needs an username and his password
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the database
        password - the password of the user
        Returns:
        a bool, if the hook is successfully connected
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there are unexpected errors

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Checks, if a connection exists and is used. If there is no connection, or the connection is closed, the method will return false. Else the method will return true.
        Returns:
        is the connection can be used.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there are unexpected errors

      • disconnect

        public boolean disconnect()
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Disconnect from a MySQL-Database if this object is connected
        Returns:
        the result. true if the object is disconnected successful, false if the object isn't connected at all
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there are unexpected errors

      • getConnection

        public java.sql.Connection getConnection()
        return the actual connection
        Returns:
        the actual connection as Connection-Interface

      • executeVoidStatement

        public boolean executeVoidStatement(java.lang.String statement,
                                    java.lang.String... variables)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Execute a Void-Statement. A void statement is a statement, that returns a bool instead of a table like INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE.
        Parameters:
        statement - The statement
        variables - the arguments in the right order. Variables in statements are displayed with '?'
        Returns:
        a bool, which contains the result
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If there were an error in the MySQL-Statement
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection is closed of not availiable (show isConnected() for more informations)

      • executeStatement

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<MySQL.Table> executeStatement(java.lang.String statement,
                                                                 java.lang.String... variables)
                                                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Execute a statement and returns a table. This method is used with the "SELECT"-Statement. The return-type is a table which has columns and tuples.
        Parameters:
        statement - The statement
        variables - the arguments in the right order. Variables in statements are displayred with '?'
        Returns:
        the table as table object
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If there is an error in your MySQL-Statement
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection is closed of not availiable (show isConnected() for more informations)
